meanings.def: involving a lot of work or activity done in a short time
examples: highly intensive courses for business and professional people
The course was really intense—I found it difficult to wind down at the end of each day.
The five-day intensive course runs from 24 to 28 July.

meanings.def: complete and extremely detailed; done with a lot of care
examples: His disappearance has been the subject of intensive investigation.

meanings.def: aimed at producing as much food as possible using as little land or as little money as possible
examples: Traditionally reared animals grow more slowly than those reared under intensive farming conditions.
